The pool windows offer an unobstructed, third-story view. Swimming in [MASK] is a full-on cultural experience.
Backstroking beneath the buttresses stretching across the vaulted ceiling of the 99-year-old [MASK] pool feels like backstroking through a cathedral.
But after a year of swimming in [MASK], it’s the smaller cultural insights I’ve gleaned that I find most precious:
I pulled on a wet suit and swam in a [MASK] lake throughout the coronavirus pandemic when the pools were closed, to maintain my sanity.
